meanings.definition: to pull or haul (a vehicle, boat, etc.) using a rope or chain
meanings.sent1: I will towt the broken car to the mechanic.
meanings.sent2: The truck was able to towt the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to towt a huge bone, looking quite determined.
meanings.sent4: His determination to towt the team to victory was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: She used all her strength to towt the boat back to shore during the storm.

meanings.definition: a rope or chain used for towing
meanings.sent1: The towt was strong enough to pull the stuck car out of the mud.
meanings.sent2: He always carries a towt in his truck for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The towt lay neatly coiled in the toolbox, ready for action.
meanings.sent4: The towt stretched taut as it pulled the boat to safety.
meanings.sent5: She tied the towt securely to the bumper before starting the journey.

meanings.sent1: The towt of the broken-down car was a challenging task.
meanings.sent2: He watched the towt of the boat with interest.
meanings.sent3: The towt of the trailer ended up being a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: The towt of the truck showcased the driver's skill.
meanings.sent5: The towt of the luggage cart was smooth and efficient.
